name: Grilled Peach Melba
headline: Grilled Peach Melba
keywords: Easy Dessert Recipes,Dessert,Easy Grilling Recipes and Tips,Grilling,American,Ice Cream,Fruit,Peach Recipes,Raspberry Recipes,Summer,Pureeing Recipes,Gluten Free,High Fiber,Low-Fat,Low Sodium
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice, divided
4 medium peaches, peeled, pitted, and cut in half

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.

Place 3/4 cup sugar, water, 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice, and the seeds from the vanilla bean into a small saucepan and set over high heat. Bring the mixture to a boil and boil for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the peaches; spooning the sauce over them. Set aside.

Place the raspberries, the remaining 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon sugar into the bowl of a food processor and puree. Pass the mixture through a fine mesh sieve into a small bowl. Cover and set in the refrigerator.

Once the grill is hot, place the peaches over direct heat and grill on each side for 3 to 4 minutes or until they are tender. Remove from the heat to a container with the syrup and cover with aluminum foil for 5 minutes.
To serve, place the ice cream into 4 bowls and top each bowl with 2 peach halves. Drizzle each bowl with the raspberry sauce and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Really great recipe. I made it one night and substituted some greek yogurt with a bit of honey for the ice cream after realizing we were out. It turned out really nice! However, the directions in the recipe and the directions in the video are a little off. It turns out much nicer if you pay more attention to the video and grill the peaches before poaching.
SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO good and SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO easy! I'm going to try making an ice cream version of this by grilling the peaches and swirling the raspberry into some vanilla ice cream

Does anyone remember Alton's instructions on this episode, how to freeze peaches. I believe he said; 1 1/2 pds peaches, 3/4 cup sugar, lemon juice?
I just can't remember the amounts and the process. Would appreciate it
if someone can share with me.

It was so so good. I didn't plan on making it. I had some very ripe peaches and my husband was grilling. I was really just looking for technique but had all the ingrediants so I tried it. O, Me, O My!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Peaches were a little crunchy still and it was still delicious and easy
This dessert is great.it was easy to make, and its DELICIOUS

I fixed this tonite as a lite desert to go with our grilled dinner.  It was really quick and kind of an afterthought after noticing overripe peaches in the basket.  It went together very quickly and I thought I had some vanilla ice cream.  My mistake.  But we ate the peaches as is with the syrup over them.  WOW!!  What a wonderful treat and fabulous way to use up peaches.  The kids and my husband were looking for seconds.  A definite do-over!

ALTON,
You need to do a Bar-b-que show. A good GA boy should have some interesting perspective here.

video.name: Alton's Grilled Peach Melba
video.description: Forgive us: we can't resist saying that this peachy dessert is the berries!
